bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Mercer County was formed in 1785 from Lincoln County. It was named for General Hugh Mercer of Fredericksburg, Virginia, who died at the Battle of Princeton during the American Revolution. The county became a part of Kentucky when it became a state in 1792.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1787, of Mercer County Circuit Court consist of a copy of a list of taxable property owned by individuals with surnames R-Z. Entries include the following information: date tax was collected, name of tax payer, and amount of tax collected.

originalsloc.p: Originals are located at the Henry E. Huntington Library, San Marino, California.
